title: Bone Canal Clots in Surface Collected Shards of Triceratops Horn are Disrupted by Exposure to Surface Environment Conditions in MT, USA
content: The findings of soft tissue in dinosaur bones remain controversial, yet reports of soft tissue continue to be made [1, 2]. To date, approximately 140 individual dinosaur bones have been demineralized (and reported) specifically for the purpose of collecting and characterizing soft tissues that might remain within them [1]. Shards are often collected along with complete dinosaur bones for analysis, however single shards do not appear to be widely studied histologically or via demineralization [1, 2].
